headline: Revisiting 5 Sites and a Bygone Era Downtown
abstract: One hundred years ago, newspapers, radios and fishmongers ruled the oldest neighborhood in New York.
lead_paragraph: Itâ€™s no secret that Lower Manhattan has completely remade itself. Again. Over the past decade or so, the global financial center, which used to become a ghost town on evenings and weekends after business hours, has developed into a 24/7 neighborhood teeming with hotels, restaurants and young parents pushing strollers.
